results.title: The Dehumanizing city...and Hymie Schultz
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hiller, George Justin, Colombia Pictures and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Adapted from the film “The Tiger makes out” with Eli Wallach, the theme here is the modern individual in conflict with complex bureaucratic systems. Waking up one morning to the callous impersonality of big city life, Hymie Schultz, mailman, decides to fight back. Bureaucracy, however, proves more stubborn than he, and at the end of the day defeated and helpless, he retreats, one individual lost among many.

group_works.title: Magnus and the beansteak
group_works.creator_credit: Harris Watts, John Fairley and Yorkshire Television

results.title: Magnus and the beansteak
results.creator_credit: Harris Watts, John Fairley and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Scientists”.
The views of food technologist, Magnus Pyke on the production of synthetic foods derived from soya beans and chemicals, that could prevent heart disease and help to feed some of the world’s undernourished population.

results.title: What would happen if...? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Quick and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies Series”.
First grade children sort materials, and compare wood with sawdust. Second grade children experiment with objects and are introduced to the terms interaction, sub-systems and variables. Third graders find which part of a mixture changes the colour of a BTB/vinegar solution, and experiment with changing variables.

results.title: Let's try it (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Quick and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies Series”.
Fifth grade children, working with the communities unit, observed crickets in their terraria and set up experiments to find out what the crickets eat. Later children observe frogs eating some of their crickets and so on. The children’s experiences provide background for the introduction of the concept of a community.

results.title: Energy and models (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies”.
Electric and magnetic interaction demonstrate the S.C.I.S. learning cycle - exploration, invention discovery. The use of a higher process of “model” in science employing a link between the use of black box and electric current is demonstrated

results.title: Don't tell me I'll find out (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Quick and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies”.
Organisms: includes first grade children observing aquaria and seed planting. Lifecycles: second graders plant and observe growth of beans, also observe fruitfly in pupae and adult stages. Populations: third grade children observe crickets eating clover and chameleons eating crickets, introducing the terms predator and prey.

group_works.title: Know your foods
group_works.creator_credit: Stanley Moore and Australian Instructional Films

results.title: Know your foods
results.creator_credit: Stanley Moore and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Science”.
Stresses the part food plays in the development of the human body. Illustrating with varius food types, the film explains the meaning of such terms as calories, proteins and vitamins and how to obtain sufficient of these for correct diet. The film concludes with five simple rules for healthy living.
